name: institutionally
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to an institution (= a large and important organization), or to institutions as a whole: Judges can only uphold the law and its values if they are institutionally independent. The country is institutionally weak.
More examplesFewer examplesThe report examined whether the corporation was institutionally biased in its reporting of the war.Our aim is to achieve progress through an institutionally based global system.An institutionally approved procedure was not needed in this case.Firstly, we looked at several studies of institutionally looked-after children.
